Immediately after sleep, except when kept unlocked by %1$s
%1$s after sleep, except when kept unlocked by %2$s
"To use your fingerprint to unlock your screen or confirm purchases, we'll need to:"
Just touch the fingerprint sensor to unlock your phone, authorise purchases or sign in to apps.
Use a pattern, PIN or password as your backup screen lock method when fingerprint is not available.
The sensor is located on the power button on the right-hand side of the phone.
"Touch the sensor lightly with your finger and lift it after you've felt a vibration."
Whenever you see this icon, you can use your fingerprint for identification or to authorise a purchase.
In addition to unlocking your phone, you can also use your fingerprint to authorise purchases and app access.
Screen lock option disabled. You can still use your fingerprint to authorise purchases and app access.
You can add up to %d fingerprints

"You can encrypt your accounts, settings, downloaded apps and their data, media and other files. After you've encrypted your phone, assuming that you've set up a screen lock (that is, a pattern or numeric PIN or password), you'll need to unlock the screen to decrypt the phone every time you power it on. The only other way to decrypt is to perform a factory data reset, which erases all of your data.
Encryption takes one hour or longer. You must start with a charged battery and keep your phone plugged in throughout the process. If you interrupt it, you'll lose some or all of your data."
You must set a lock screen PIN, pattern or password before you can start encryption.
"The encryption operation is irreversible, and if you interrupt it, you'll lose data. Encryption takes one hour or longer, during which time the phone will restart several times."
Wait while your phone is being encrypted. ^1% complete.
Wait while your phone is being encrypted. Time remaining: ^1
Warning: Your device will be wiped after ^1 more failed unlocking attempts!

"Encryption was interrupted and can't be completed. As a result, the data on your phone is no longer accessible.
To resume using your phone, you need to perform a factory reset. When you set up your phone after the reset, you'll have the opportunity to restore any data that was backed up to your Google Account."

"The password you have entered is correct, but unfortunately your data has been corrupted.
To resume using your phone, you need to perform a factory reset. When you set up your phone after the reset, you'll have the opportunity to restore any data that was backed up to your Google Account."
Change or disable pattern, PIN or password security
Disabled by administrator, encryption policy or credential storage
"Once you've set up a screen lock, you can also set up your fingerprint in Settings > Security."

"Device protection features will not work without your pattern.
Your saved fingerprints will also be removed from this device and you won't be able to unlock your phone, authorise purchases or sign in to apps with them."

"Device protection features will not work without your PIN.
Your saved fingerprints will also be removed from this device and you won't be able to unlock your phone, authorise purchases or sign in to apps with them."

"Device protection features will not work without your password.
Your saved fingerprints will also be removed from this device and you won't be able to unlock your phone, authorise purchases or sign in to apps with them."

"Device protection features will not work without your screen lock.
Your saved fingerprints will also be removed from this device and you won't be able to unlock your phone, authorise purchases or sign in to apps with them."

Password must contain at least one letter
Password must contain at least one digit
Password must contain at least one symbol
"The device administrator doesn't allow using a recent password."
Type the pairing code, then press Return or Enter

You may also need to enter this passkey on the other device.

%1$s wants to access your contacts and call history.
%1$s wants to pair with Bluetooth. When connected, it will have access to your contacts and call history.

%1$s manages your device and doesn’t allow modifying or deleting this Wi-Fi network. For more information, contact your administrator.

"When this feature is turned on, you can beam app content to another NFC-capable device by holding the devices close together. For example, you can beam Browser pages, YouTube videos, People contacts and more.
Just bring the devices together so that the NFC detection areas touch each other, then tap your screen. The app determines what is beamed."
Let a Wi‑Fi assistant automatically connect to open networks determined to be high quality
To improve location accuracy, system apps and services can still scan for Wi‑Fi networks. You can change this in LINK_BEGINscanning settingsLINK_END.
Minimise battery usage when Wi-Fi is on
Switch to mobile data if Wi‑Fi loses Internet access.
To see available networks, turn on Wi-Fi.
Press the Wi‑Fi Protected Setup button on your router. It may be called \"WPS\" or marked with this symbol:
WPS succeeded. Connecting to the network…
Request failed. Please try again in a few minutes.
%1$s requires you to sign in online before you connect to the network.

"If you skip Wi‑Fi setup:
"
"Your phone won't have an Internet connection.""

"You won't get software updates until you connect to the Internet.""

"This ^1 is safely ejected, but still available.
To use this ^1, you have to mount it first."

"This ^1 is corrupted.

"This device doesn’t support this ^1.
To use this ^1 with this device, you have to set it up first."

"After formatting, you can use this ^1 in other devices.
All data on this ^1 will be erased. Consider backing up first.
"Back up photos & other media" Move your media files to alternative storage on this device, or transfer them to a computer using a USB cable.
"Back up apps" All apps stored on this ^1 will be uninstalled and their data will be erased. To keep these apps, move them to alternative storage on this device."

When you eject this ^1, apps stored on it will stop working, and media files stored on it will not be available until it is reinserted."
This ^1 is formatted to work on this device only. It won’t work on any others."

"To use the apps, photos or data this ^1 contains, reinsert it.
Alternatively, you can choose to forget this storage if the device isn’t available.
If you choose to forget, all the data the device contains will be lost forever.
You can reinstall the apps later, but their data stored on this device will be lost."
All the apps, photos and data stored on this ^1 will be lost forever.

"Other includes shared files saved by apps, files downloaded from the Internet or Bluetooth, Android files and so on.
To see the entire contents of this ^1, touch Explore."

"^1 may have saved photos, music, movies, apps or other data that is taking up ^2 of storage.
To view details, switch to ^1."

"This requires the ^1 to be formatted to make it secure.
After formatting, this ^1 will only work in this device.
"Formatting erases all data currently stored on the ^1. To avoid losing the data, consider backing it up.

"This requires the ^1 to be formatted.
"Formatting erases all data currently stored on the ^1. To avoid losing the data, consider backing it up.

"You can move your photos, files and some apps to this new ^1.
The move takes about ^2 and will free ^3 on internal storage. Some apps won’t work while it’s underway."

string.name: storage_wizard_migrate_confirm_body

resources.string: "During the move: • Don't remove the ^1. • Some apps won't work correctly. • Keep the device charged."
Your ^1 is ready to use with photos and other media.

"Your new ^1 is working.
To move photos, files and app data to this device, go to Settings > Storage."

"Moving ^1 and its data to ^2 will take only a few moments. You won't be able to use the app until the move is complete.
Don't remove the ^2 during the move."

"Don't remove the ^1 during the move.
The ^2 app on this device won't be available until the move is complete."

"This ^1 appears to be slow.
You can continue, but apps moved to this location may stutter and data transfers may take a long time.
Consider using a faster ^1 for better performance."

"When this feature is turned on, you can zoom in and out by triple-tapping the screen.
While zoomed in, you can:
"
"Pan: Drag two or more fingers across the screen.
"
Adjust zoom level: Pinch two or more fingers together or spread them apart."
You can also temporarily magnify what's under your finger by triple-tapping and holding. In this magnified state, you can drag your finger to explore different parts of the screen. Lift your finger to return to your previous state.
Note: Triple-tap for magnification works everywhere except the keyboard and navigation bar."
Update screen magnification on app transitions

Battery use is an approximation of power use and does not include every source of battery drain. Miscellaneous is the difference between the computed approximate power use and the actual drain observed on the battery.

"Automatically back up device data (such as Wi-Fi passwords and call history) and app data (such as settings and files stored by apps) remotely.
When you turn on automatic backup, device and app data is periodically saved remotely. App data can be any data that an app has saved (based on developer settings), including potentially sensitive data such as contacts, messages and photos."
Activating this administrator will allow the app %1$s to perform the following operations:
This administrator is active and allows the app %1$s to perform the following operations:

"By proceeding, your User will be managed by your Administrator which may also be able to store associated data, in addition to your personal data.
Your Administrator has the ability to monitor and manage settings, access, apps and data associated with this User, including network activity and your device’s location information."

"Restricting background data is only possible if you've set a mobile data limit."

"Any changes that you make to your accounts on the web will be automatically copied to your phone.
Some accounts may also automatically copy any changes that you make on the phone to the web. A Google Account works this way."

"Your mobile data connection will be disabled when the specified limit is reached.
As data usage is measured by your phone, and your service provider may account for usage differently, consider using a conservative limit."

"If you restrict background mobile data, some apps and services won't work unless you're connected to Wi‑Fi.
This setting affects all users on this phone."
"%2$s: about %1$s used, as measured by your phone. Your provider's data usage accounting may differ."

When you add a new user, that person needs to set up their space.
Any user can update apps for all other users."

"When this setting is turned on, you can use screen pinning to keep the current screen in view until you unpin.
To use screen pinning:
1. Make sure screen pinning is turned on.
2. Open the screen you want to pin.
3. Tap □ (Recent apps key).
4. Swipe up, then tap the pin icon."

"You can further protect this device by making it require your PIN before starting up. Until the device starts up, it can't receive calls, messages or notifications, including alarms.
This helps protect data on lost or stolen devices."

"You can further protect this device by making it require your pattern before starting up. Until the device starts up, it can't receive calls, messages or notifications, including alarms.
This helps protect data on lost or stolen devices."

"You can further protect this device by making it require your password before starting up. Until the device starts up, it can't receive calls, messages or notifications, including alarms.
This helps protect data on lost or stolen devices."

"In addition to using your fingerprint to unlock your device, you can further protect this device by requiring your PIN before it starts up. Until the device starts up, it can’t receive calls, messages or notifications, including alarms.
This helps protect data on lost or stolen devices."

"In addition to using your fingerprint to unlock your device, you can further protect this device by requiring your pattern before it starts up. Until the device starts up, it can’t receive calls, messages or notifications, including alarms.

Enable one or more functions in STAMINA mode to optimise battery time.
%s sends and receives data in the background and uses processing power. You may reduce battery consumption by uninstalling it or enabling STAMINA mode.

"Low battery mode turns off power-consuming features and settings when the battery is below a preset level. Use when your battery power is running low and you can't charge your device. You will still receive phone calls and text messages."
"Low battery mode turns off power-consuming features and settings when the battery is below a preset level. Use when your battery power is running low and you can't charge your device."

"Ultra STAMINA mode will extend battery lifetime significantly. It can be used when you can't charge your device for a long time.
Only a few basic functions, such as Phone and Messaging will be available. Tap \"More info\" for more details.
Note that Internet connection through Wi-Fi and Mobile data will be disabled."
Please wait a moment, then try activating Ultra STAMINA Mode again.
Prolongs battery time extensively by limiting the available apps to the minimum required

"When STAMINA mode is activated, GPS, vibration, image enhancement, rendering performance etc. are restricted to reduce battery consumption. Also, as background data is restricted, Email and other apps that rely on syncing may not be updated.
Note that an Android power-saving feature is active even when STAMINA mode is not activated, so background data may be restricted during sleep mode.
To make apps active in standby, tap Battery optimisation in the options menu.
All restrictions are disabled while charging."

"When STAMINA mode is activated, GPS, vibration, image enhancement, etc. are restricted to reduce battery consumption. Also, as background data is restricted, Email and other apps that rely on syncing may not be updated.
To make apps active in standby, tap Battery optimisation in the options menu.
All restrictions are disabled while charging."

"When STAMINA mode is activated, GPS, vibration, etc. are restricted to reduce battery consumption. Also, as background data is restricted, Email and other apps that rely on syncing may not be updated.
To make apps active in standby, tap Battery optimisation in the options menu.
All restrictions are disabled while charging."

Apps added will use network connections. This will increase the battery consumption. Note that the functions marked in Advanced STAMINA mode settings are not allowed to use network connections, even if you add the same functions/apps in this list.

"Ultra STAMINA mode will extend the battery lifetime significantly. Note that Internet connection via Wi-Fi and Mobile data will be disabled. Your Home screen will be switched to Ultra STAMINA mode Home.
Apps available in Ultra STAMINA mode"
STAMINA mode restricts device performance and some functions to reduce battery consumption. Select a restriction level in Power saving level.
Make sure that your other device is in pairing mode, then select it from the list.
Make sure that you confirm the pairing on the other device
Notifications will be shown until you swipe to dismiss them. If disabled, only new notifications will be shown on the lock screen.
You have attempted to unlock the phone incorrectly ^1 times. After ^2 more unsuccessful attempts, the phone will be reset to factory default and all user data will be lost.
Note: Any data which is encrypted by this device on an SD card will be unreadable after a factory data reset.
You need to draw your unlock pattern to change the SD card encryption setting.
A security policy is restricting deactivation of SD card encryption

"Any changes that you make to your accounts on the web will be automatically copied to your phone.
Some accounts may also automatically copy any changes that you make on the phone to the web.
To select what type of information to sync within each account, go to Settings > Accounts & sync.
Data transmission charges may apply when updates are made to your phone."
You cannot use the Internet on your phone while tethering. Do you want to continue to tether?
"You cannot use the Internet on your phone while tethering. You may be able to if you choose another network. Please always check the other network's charges. Do you want to continue to tether?"
Back up Xperia™-exclusive content, such as home screen layouts, email accounts and conversations, periodically to an online account.
"Backup to online account is unavailable until after you've updated"

Fingerprint enrolment time limit reached. Try again.

"You won't be able to use your fingerprints to unlock your phone, authorise purchases or sign in to apps with them."

Maximise colours while viewing photos and videos, giving you surreal, vibrant, super-vivid images

Mirror your Xperia™ on your Google Cast™-compliant TV or device (such as Chromecast™)

The SD card will unmount automatically when the battery cover is removed to prevent data loss.

"This will reset all of your phone's settings, including: "
Phone system settings" "
Bundled application settings" It will not erase: "
User specified settings" "
Installed applications" "
SD card files, such as music or photos

"You can use your device as a Mobile Hotspot. This allows other devices (maximum 10) to connect to it via a Wi-Fi network. The connected devices will have access to the Internet via your mobile network connection. Mobile Hotspot uses mobile data and can result in additional charges.
Mobile Hotspot consumes more battery. Connect the device to an outlet to extend the battery life."
Wait until the connection with the access point has been established

"Turn on [Use when screen off] and select apps that you wish to run with reduced functionality during sleep mode. The [Battery draining apps] tab shows apps that consume a lot of battery power. The bar below each app indicates battery power consumption."

"Turn on [Use when screen off] and select apps that you wish to run with reduced functionality during sleep mode. The [Battery draining apps] tab shows apps that consume a lot of battery power. The bar below each app indicates battery power consumption."

"You can select apps to run with reduced functionality during sleep mode. If selected apps do not function properly, deselect them.
The notification light for all apps flashes in the same colour at the same frequency during sleep mode.
STAMINA mode becomes deactivated while charging."

"If selected apps do not function properly, deselect them.
STAMINA mode is deactivated while you are using or charging the device."

"STAMINA mode saves battery power by adjusting device settings. You can choose applications to run with reduced functionality during sleep mode. (This helps you save battery power because most apps keep draining the battery even during sleep mode.)
Functions disabled for selected apps: - Wi-Fi - Mobile data - Timer
The notification light for all apps flashes in the same colour at the same frequency during sleep mode.
STAMINA mode is deactivated while you are controlling the device."

"STAMINA mode saves battery power by disabling network connections and the timer function during sleep mode for your selected apps. (This helps you save battery power because most apps keep draining the battery even during sleep mode.)
STAMINA mode also adjusts display settings to get the most battery life when the screen is on."
Adjust device settings (e.g. screen frame rate) and turn off Image enhancement to save power when the screen is on
